content: Kimia Ghobadi – JHU CSSE Skip to content Welcome to Dr. Ghobadi's Lab Kimia Ghobadi John C. Malone Assistant Professor I am the Johns C. Malone Assistant Professor in Civil and Systems Engineering at Johns Hopkins University. I am  a member of Center for Systems Science and Engineering (CSSE) and the Malone Center for Engineering in Healthcare. My main research interest is developing data-driven optimization frameworks for healthcare applications. Many of my projects are in collaborations with healthcare entities, including the Johns Hopkins Hospital. Prior to joining JHU, I obtained my PhD in Industrial Engineering at the University of Toronto (collaborating with the Princess Margaret Cancer Centre) and was a post-doctoral fellow at the MIT Sloan School of Management in collaboration with the Massachusetts General Hospital. Research Interests My research is inspired by data-driven applications of operations research. I am interested in both developing theory and empirical work. My recent work has focused on optimization models and algorithms with healthcare applications.Research Interest Topics: Data-driven operational research, Healthcare, Data analytics, Optimization techniques (inverse optimization, integer programming), Algorithms (approximation, heuristic, deterministic).
